name: Risk importer
description: Bulk import risks from CSV or Excel files. Map columns, preview data, and import in one workflow.
author: VerifyWise
detailedDescription:
The Risk Importer plugin enables bulk import of risks from spreadsheet files. Features include:

• Support for CSV and Excel (.xlsx) files
• Column mapping UI to match your file structure
• Preview with validation before import
• Duplicate detection with skip/overwrite/create options
• Auto-calculation of risk levels
• Import to projects, use cases, or frameworks

Perfect for teams migrating from spreadsheets or other GRC tools.

maxFileSizeMB.label: Maximum file size (MB)
maxFileSizeMB.description: Maximum allowed file size for upload. Larger files may slow down parsing.

defaultRiskType.label: Default risk type
defaultRiskType.description: Pre-selected risk type when opening the import modal.

defaultDuplicateAction.label: Default duplicate action
defaultDuplicateAction.description: Default action when duplicate risks are detected during import.

autoCalculateRiskLevel.label: Auto-calculate risk level
autoCalculateRiskLevel.description: Automatically calculate risk level from likelihood and severity if not provided.

previewRowCount.label: Preview row count
previewRowCount.description: Number of rows to show in the preview step.

faq.question: What file formats are supported?
faq.answer: The plugin supports CSV files and Excel files (.xlsx). For Excel files with multiple sheets, the first sheet is used.

faq.question: Which fields are required?
faq.answer: Only risk_name and risk_description are required. Risk owner is assigned through the UI after import. All other fields are optional and will use defaults if not mapped.

faq.question: How are duplicates handled?
faq.answer: Before import, the plugin checks for existing risks with the same name. You can choose to skip, overwrite, or create duplicates for each conflict.

faq.question: Is the risk level calculated automatically?
faq.answer: Yes, if you provide likelihood and severity, the risk_level_autocalculated field is computed automatically based on the risk matrix.
